the number of deaths at 2,000. 1 think these estimates will prove
to be somewhat erroneous, and that the number of deaths most
probably did not exceed 1600.
A complete census of the 3d ward was taken by the Belief Com
mittee, which furnished the following statistics:—
Population—whites, 638; colored, 558; total, 1,196.
Fever cases—whites, 579; colored, 213; total, 792, or two-thirds
of the inhabitants.
Deaths—whites, 159; colored, 13; total, 172, or 21.70 per cent, of
the attacked.
